answers.answer: I too have PCOS and I take clomid along with metformin in order to O...you should ask your doc about prescribing metformin...I wouldn't take the BC if you are trying to get pregnant...See if he/she will go ahead and let you try clomid with your next period...I'm praying that I get my BFP this cycle...good luck to you...Oh and pcos is a hormone abnormality(imbalance)...the symptoms are very broad, but the most common are obesity, excessive hair growth (in unwanted places), diabetes,and the list goes on...you can help your chances of becoming preggo by tracking your cycles and getting to know your fertility signs...it takes some getting use to, but it can be done

question: I found out about a month ago that I have pcos with no real info from the dr. as to what should be done. he just gave me birth control pills and said that if I wanted to conceive I would have to take clomid. Is this true? Has anyone conceived naturally after coming off the pill? I am thinking of taking Vitex anyone know anything about this too. Please share your stories! Thank you.
title: Diagnosed with pcos but want to get pregnant!
